# Harrison-Hancock Hardware Company Building

| designated_other1_number       = 154-0029

| location                       = 24 E. Main St., Christiansburg, Virginia

Harrison-Hancock Hardware Company Building was a historic commercial building located at Christiansburg, Montgomery County, Virginia.  It was built in 1910, and was a 3 1/2-story, concrete-masonry building with a shed roof.  It featured a stepped parapet and a front parapet with cornice.  It was demolished for a parking lot in 1995â€“1996.
It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1989, and delisted in 2001.
